(oui ou non)") while True: rejouer = input("> ").strip().lower() if rejouer in ["oui", "non"]: break else: print("Vous devez rÃ©pondre par 'oui' ou 'non' ") if rejouer == "non": print("Merci d'avoir jouÃ©") break if __name__ == "__main__": print(MENU) main() ğŸ” Code Breakdown # The program generates a random 3-digit secret number. Frustrated, I searched for solutions and came across a Linux devâ€™s tutorial. Out of curiosity, I tested his setup and discovered:
Shift + Alt + W for < and Shift + Alt + X for >.

ğŸ’¥ The moment I decided I would never code on Windows again.

âŒ Performance issues â€“ Windows slows down with every update. Linux stays fast and efficient.
âŒ Bloatware & background processes â€“ I hated unnecessary software eating up resources.
âŒ Forced updates â€“ Windows decides when to restart. Linux lets me be in control.

Kali Linux â€“ My first experience, but too niche for daily use. Ubuntu WSL & MX Linux â€“ First real steps into the Linux world. Linux Mint â€“ User-friendly, but too bloated for me. 5. The Game-Changing Discoveries ğŸ’¡ # ğŸ’¡ Tiling Window Managers (i3, bspwm) â†’ My workflow became lightning fast.
ğŸ’¡ Package Management â€“ Learning Pacman (Arch), APT (Debian), XBPS (Void).

âš¡ XBPS package manager â€“ Faster and simpler than APT or Pacman.
